name: MICHIGAN, et al., petitioners, v. ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY, et al.

court.name: Supreme Court of the United States

parties:
MICHIGAN, et al., petitioners,
v.
ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY, et al.

opinions.text: Motion of Chamber of Commerce of the United States for leave to file a brief as amicus curiaegranted. Petition for writ of certiorari to the United States Court of Appeals for the District of Columbia Circuit granted limited to the following question: "Whether the Environmental Protection Agency unreasonably refused to consider cost in determining whether it is appropriate to regulate hazardous air pollutants emitted by electric utilities." The cases are consolidated and a total of one hour is allotted for oral argument.

casebody.head_matter:
MICHIGAN, et al., petitioners,
v.
ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AGENCY, et al.
No. 14-46.
Supreme Court of the United States
Nov. 25, 2014.
Opinion
